sentence.Network_en: Politicians will grandstand about remaking finance.

entry.def: A grandstand is a covered stand with rows of seats for people to sit on at sporting events.

means.word_mean: 1. the audience at a stadium or racetrack
2. a stand at a racecourse or stadium consisting of tiers with rows of individual seats that are under a protective roof
1. perform ostentatiously in order to impress the audience and with an eye to the applause;

sentences.sentence: "She never misses a chance to grandstand"

auth_sentence.content: Visitors can share the glamour of the occasion and the views with grandstand seats.
